abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Rural Employment
            Project for Algeria was satisfactory, the sustainability was
            likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: The project
            has demonstrated that it is possible to address urgent
            issues of rural unemployment and socioeconomic and political
            instability and, at the same time, create economic assets
            with long-term benefits and sustainable livelihood. To
            maximize involvement of benefiting communities, staff should
            be trained to work with them and understand what it takes to
            make them willing participants. Monitoring and evaluation,
            and good economic analysis help authorities to make the
            right decisions and choices.
